body:
We were previously starting a DevTools server on project open; this changes to starting the server when it's first requested (or if a previous attempt to start failed).

This change also adds exception logging and completion for various error conditions while starting the server.

comment_data.body: Do we need to dispose() the devToolsInstance here?
Consider passing the devToolsInstance as a parameter to startServer() so that we always complete the right future (given that this field is reused over time for new instances).
Is dispose mainly for if an object has dependencies? Since the instance just holds a hostname and port, I think it may not be needed.

I'm not sure if this fully addresses the problem, but I put the future into an atomic reference to ensure that there can only be one at a time (one future, and therefore one process / process handler). It could be problematic if more than one server gets started and the reference to shut it down on close gets lost.
Gotcha (yeah, it's just needed for heavier weight things).

commit.message: Start DevTools server on first request and handle exceptions
Make future atomic to ensure only one

repo.description: Flutter makes it easy and fast to build beautiful mobile apps.
repo.name: flutter-intellij

title: Start DevTools server on first request and handle exceptions
